content.raw:
These are all templates anyway, so the definitions of the symbols will exist in each compilation unit that ever used them.

The difference in the symbol name would only matter if one library tried to use a version of the symbol as it was compiled by another library, which would require someone somewhere to have done an `extern template` declaration, which we’ve never done
content.html:
These are all templates anyway, so the definitions of the symbols will exist in each compilation unit that ever used them.

The difference in the symbol name would only matter if one library tried to use a version of the symbol as it was compiled by another library, which would require someone somewhere to have done an extern template declaration, which we’ve never done
